result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.
Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
No new crimes rising to the level of probable cause.
Court makes the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of this sentence.
Comply with any conditions set in Jefferson County.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Successfully complete 20 hours of community service with a non-profit organization.

records.addlTxt:
15RM049990  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11/06/2015

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately 
          or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
     *   Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.
     *   No new crimes rising to the level of probable cause.
     *   Comply with any conditions set in Jefferson County.

Court makes the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of this sentence.
 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report (positive drug test) received and filed.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell appearing via telephone.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court sets cash bail.  Case remains calendared for plea/sentencing on 11/10/15 in Branch 45.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense requests additional time.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court, PRO SE.  No appearance for the State of Wisconsin. Reviewed by the court, Justice Point Violation Report: Positive Drug Test. Court admonished the defendant. Case remains set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23 on 10/7/15 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of defense counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony case in another county and requests a status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.   Court reviewed Justice Point report.
  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court amends Signature bond from $750.00 to 500.00
All other conditions of bond remains the same.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp NOT  in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case recalled at 4:59pm: 
Court informed from Justice Point Worker that the report for the defendant has been updated.
Court amends the Signature bond previous set.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant - Beason Shkoukani.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Brianna Brooke Irene Schliepp in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
